content: Yeah, I've been trying to be patient and take my time with the weathering process. I've been using Vallejo Model Color washes and have been experimenting with different techniques like streaking and drybrushing. I've also been trying to reference real-world examples of weathered tanks and cars to get a sense of how the rust and dirt accumulate. But I think I might need to try out some new products, like Mig Productions' rust paints, to get a more realistic look. Do you think I should start with their "Russian Rust" set for my T-34?
